newsitem.title: USA: NBA BASKETBALL-KNICKS G ALLAN HOUSTON UNDERGOES WRIST SURGERY.
newsitem.headline: NBA BASKETBALL-KNICKS G ALLAN HOUSTON UNDERGOES WRIST SURGERY.

text.p: New York Knicks shooting guard Allan Houston underwent successful surgery to repair partially torn ligaments in his right wrist on Monday, the team reported.
Houston will wear a cast on the wrist for seven weeks before beginning a strength and motion rehabilitation programme.

"This was an injury that had been bothering Allan over the course of the season," said Knicks general manager Ernie Grunfeld. "The timing of the surgery, at the start of the off-season, could not have worked out better.
"We are looking forward to having Allan at full strength when we begin training camp in October," Grunfeld said.
Houston, who signed a seven-year, $56 million free agent contract with the Knicks last off-season, averaged 14.8 points and shot 42.3 percent from the field during the regular season.

In the playoffs, he averaged 19.2 points and shot 50 percent (26-of-52) from three-point range, but was one of the players suspended for one game during the Eastern Conference semifinals with the Miami Heat for leaving the Knicks bench during an altercation.
